page.title: 03Crops on Barton Abbey Estate
page.content:
In 1985, the following crops were grown: Cereals - winter wheat, winter barley and spring barley (these are cash crops subsidised by the EEC, so their acreage is increasing); Rape - this is grown for seed, its oil content is needed for processing (a relatively new crop in the last fifteen years); Beans - grown for animal feed, particularly high in protein; Grass - grown for forage for cattle; and permanent pasture, including the parkland used for grazing sheep.
Most farms in this area are, like this, a mixture of different types of arable crop and different types of stock.
